recommendations.text: Integrate AI into labour reform discussions Ecuador should adopt clear regula- tions concerning works generated by artificial intelligence, distinguish- ing between fully automated out- puts with no substantial human input and those in which AI is used as an auxiliary tool. Legislation must clarify whether such content is eligible for copyright protection and, if so, de- termine the rightful rights holder— whether it be the model developer, the user, or another party. Addition- ally, it is recommended to regulate the use of copyrighted works for AI training, requiring prior consent, fair attribution, and the possibility of re- muneration for rights holders. This regulation should aim to balance the promotion of innovation with the ef- fective protection of the country’s cultural, scientific, and creative heri- tage, with particular attention to na- tional authors and Indigenous peo- ples whose traditional knowledge is constitutionally recognized. Responsible Institutions: National Assembly of Ecuador, SENADI (National Service for Intellectual Rights) Priority: Medium Labor regulation is a topic of constant debate in the country. It is crucial to consider the interrelationship be- tween the use of technology, process automation and employability in the context of labour reform, as well as the skills that need to be developed and their alignment with labour rights. Although currently the impact of AI on the labour sector is not evident, it is vital to recognize that this technolo- gy can increase productive efficiency, but it can also generate an increase in unemployment and informality. 81 National AI Strategy The Ministry of Labor must build la- bour reconversion policies that in- clude the promotion of digital com- petencies and skills in the use of AI. These initiatives should include training and awareness programs aimed at workers on the use of tech- nological tools and the implications of AI in the productive sector. recommendations.text: Broaden AI governance by involving multiple ministries, state levels, private sector, academia, and civil society Starting the path to implement par- ticipatory governance is essential to recognize the relevance of the private sector and academia in the economic dimension. This need highlights the importance of estab- lishing an approach that goes be- yond technical infrastructure and the role of the public sector. The integra- tion of actors linked to areas such as Ecuador: Artificial Intelligence Readiness Assessment Report 82 the labour market, investment, and competitiveness is required. In this context, the intervention of institu- tions such as the Ecuadorian Cham- ber of Innovation and Technology (CITEC), chambers of commerce, as well as academia and civil society organizations, becomes vital. Incor- porating these stakeholders ensures that issues related to production, re- search, citizen participation, and the protection of rights are adequately addressed in the discussion con- cerning the implications of artificial intelligence for Ecuadorian society. Therefore, it is recommended to ex- pand the stakeholder mapping con- ducted by MINTEL. Responsible Institutions: MINTEL, National Assembly of Ecuador, Chambers, Academy and Social Organizations Priority: High

recommendations.title: Empower MINTEL and SENESCYT to take a leading role in AI policy and coordination MINTEL is required to take a more active role in AI governance,...
recommendations.text: Empower MINTEL and SENESCYT to take a leading role in AI policy and coordination MINTEL is required to take a more active role in AI governance, focusing especially on closing gaps and gen- erating infrastructure and connectiv- ity policies, which are crucial for the advancement of AI in Ecuador. This involves resolving pending issues, such as the renewal of enabling ti- tles for mobile operators and the implementation of the 5G network, the application of which can signifi- cantly improve key sectors such as logistics. It is also urgent to reduce the digital divides that limit access to the Internet and the development of capacities in emerging technol- ogies. To achieve this, public policy instruments must incorporate com- ponents related to technological in- frastructure, equipment and training. The role of SENESCYT as the gov- erning body of the national science, technology, innovation and local knowledge system is vital for artic- ulating talent development policies, promoting applied research, and coordinating with higher education institutions, preventing duplications and maximising the potential of na- tional talent is underlined. Responsible Institutions: MINTEL and SENESCYT Priority: High 83 National AI Strategy

recommendations.title: Establish mechanisms for monitoring algorithmic and ethical transparency in AI At the regional level, most AI-related public policies, agendas,...
recommendations.text: Establish mechanisms for monitoring algorithmic and ethical transparency in AI At the regional level, most AI-related public policies, agendas, strategies and governance mechanisms do not explicitly or structurally incorporate fundamental elements that facili- tate the perspective of women and diverse groups in decision-making processes, as well as specific actions to address issues of inclusion, harm or bias (UNESCO, 2024c). Ecuador is no exception in this trend. It is urgent that MINTEL implement concrete mechanisms to integrate a transformative gender approach in the design, implementation and evaluation of AI public policies. Only in this way can ethical, fair and equi- table governance be achieved. Responsible Institutions: MINTEL, Ministry of Women and Human Rights, National Council for Gender Equality, Association of Municipalities of Ecuador. Priority: High In Ecuador, there are serious gaps in terms of information and account- ability, which reinforces the urgency to design regulatory and techni- cal frameworks for the continuous monitoring of algorithmic systems. Clear and accessible disclosure on the use of AI needs to be ensured, especially with regard to personal data. This helps to strengthen in- stitutional capacities to audit the algorithms used and to consolidate the country's active participation in regional initiatives such as ALTA, promoting common standards and technical cooperation. Finally, mechanisms can be estab- lished to ensure algorithmic trans- parency16 to assess the ethical im- 16 In 2024, the country joined the Latin American Alliance for Algorithmic Transparency (ALTA) and conducted its first algorithmic transparency study, which included 546 of 1675 state entities, representing 32.6% participation. 142 automated decision systems in public services were identified, of which 35.2% use personal data, but only 9 institutions report on this (Ombudsman's Office, 2024). recommendations.title: Ensure generation of high-quality and periodic AI-related information One of the challenges for the de- velopment of effective public poli- cies on...
recommendations.text: Ensure generation of high-quality and periodic AI-related information One of the challenges for the de- velopment of effective public poli- cies on AI and the digital society in Ecuador is the absence of consol- idated, up-to-date, and freely ac- cessible technical and statistical in- formation. Therefore, it is proposed to establish and strengthen a na- tional statistical system in telecom- munications, digital society, R+D, training and AI, which allows the production of relevant data such as the number of data centers, the economic impact of AI (including its contribution to GDP and intermedi- ate consumption), usage patterns, investments, training and other as- pects related to digital infrastruc- ture. This need is evident in the de- velopment of RAM for Ecuador and requires a framework of sustained inter-institutional cooperation be- tween INEC, as the governing body of the national statistical system, MINTEL, in charge of the digital sector, and SENESCYT, responsible for the National System of Science, Technology, Innovation. SENESCYT, in particular, must es- tablish mechanisms to collect, up- date and publish periodic and quality information on public and private in- vestment in R+D, as well as on human talent specialized in AI and AI ethics. This information should be accessi- ble both on a national portal and in international repositories (such as those of RICYT or the World Bank), which would allow monitoring the impact of policies and comparison over time between countries. Collab- oration and sustained engagement among these entities would help consolidate an open data ecosystem that underpins an evidence-based digital and scientific agenda. For example, it is optimal to ensure the collaboration of entities such as ARCOTEL, INEC, INEN and SENA- DI to coordinate strategic actions. At the same time, cooperation with private sector actors and academia is imperative to create an enabling environment for AI adoption, devel- opment, and regulation. recommendations.text: Strengthen the statistical system in telecommunications, emerging tech, and digital transformation One of the primary needs is the de- velopment and strengthening of a robust statistical system, as well as relevant technical indicators, such as the number of data centers and the contribution of data centers to GDP. This aspect has been evidenced in the evaluation phase of the RAM in Ecuador (World Bank Group, 2024). The establishment of a framework for inter-institutional cooperation be- tween the National Institute of Statis- tics and Census (INEC) and MINTEL will facilitate the collection and im- provement of the collection of data and statistics on the use of AI. This, in turn, will strengthen the generation of evidence-based public policies. In addition, inter-institutional coor- dination with key entities such as SENESCYT and the Central Bank of Ecuador is required, to work on the construction and technical valida- tion of indicators related to emerging technologies, such as AI, and their impact on the economic sphere. These efforts are essential to en- sure a comprehensive and effective understanding of the role of AI in the country's development. Responsible Institutions: MINTEL, ARCOTEL, INEC, Central Bank of Ecuador. Priority: High Ecuador: Artificial Intelligence Readiness Assessment Report 86

recommendations.title: Promote transparency and integrity in AI public procurement As part of a broader strategy to strengthen institutional integrity and transparency, it...
recommendations.text: Promote transparency and integrity in AI public procurement As part of a broader strategy to strengthen institutional integrity and transparency, it is recommended that Ecuador establish a national public registry of artificial intelligence contracts. This registry should doc- ument and systematize all acqui- sitions, developments, and agree- ments involving automated systems or algorithmic technologies entered into by public entities. It would serve as a proactive transparency tool, en- abling academic and social oversight of algorithm use in public adminis- tration. Additionally, it is advisable to include mandatory clauses on algorithmic accountability, non-dis- crimination, and transparency in pro- curement documents for AI systems, particularly in sensitive sectors such as health, justice, and security. Responsible Institutions: SERCOP, National Assembly of Ecuador, Comptroller General’s Office Priority: Medium

recommendations.title: Co-design a sectoral public policy agenda linking AI and environmental sustainability It is recommended to co-design a Sectoral Public Policy Agenda...
recommendations.text: Co-design a sectoral public policy agenda linking AI and environmental sustainability It is recommended to co-design a Sectoral Public Policy Agenda on AI and the environment, through a par- ticipatory process that integrates en- tities from the public, private and ac- ademic sectors. This agenda should follow the principles of proportional- ity (efficient use of data, energy and resources), precaution (prevention of negative impacts) and sustainability (continuous assessment of the hu- man, social, economic and ecologi- cal effects of AI, in line with the Sus- tainable Development Goals). This agenda should align regulations on emerging technologies with existing environmental policies, especially with regard to the use and consump- tion of natural resources, in line with the guidelines of the Circular Econ- omy White Paper of the Ministry of Environment, Water and Ecological Transition (MAATE). In this sense, MINTEL and MAATE must jointly articulate and lead an approach that links technological development with climate action, in- corporating environmental criteria in the design, training and application of AI systems. Also, it is important to strengthen Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) man- agement strategies to maximize the social and environmental benefit of these technologies. Responsible Institutions: MINTEL, MAATE Priority: High 87 National AI Strategy

recommendations.title: Include ethics and social implications of technology in higher education curricula The development of AI in Ecuador is related to various factors,...
recommendations.text: Include ethics and social implications of technology in higher education curricula The development of AI in Ecuador is related to various factors, includ- ing international technical standards established by bodies such as the International Standards Organization (ISO), the International Electrotechni- cal Commission (IEC) (ISO JTC1 IEC, 2025), and the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IIEE). For this reason, it is necessary to carry out socialization processes with ac- tors such as companies, startups, universities and civil society orga- nizations, in order to discuss norms, standards and intellectual property at the national level. In addition to de- veloping complementary regulations that reflect the reality of the country. Responsible Institutions: MINTEL, MAATE Priority: Medium In the field of education, Ecuador has at least 45 higher education pro- grams specialized in AI, according to the website of the Council of Higher Education (CES, 2025). At the same time, there is a growing proliferation of continuing education initiatives aimed at a wider audience. Howev- er, most of these programs focus on technical itineraries, which are limited to the use of tools, leaving the impacts and social aspects of technology, and in particular of AI, almost unexplored. It is recommended to incorporate an ethical approach in media and infor- mation literacy (MIL), recognized by UNESCO as a fundamental tool to promote critical thinking, civic partic- ipation and resilience to disinforma- tion. This approach is not only limited to the understanding of traditional media content, but also empowers users to identify the biases inherent in AI systems, understand their basic functioning, and critically evaluate the provenance, intentionality, and consequences of artificially gener- ated texts, images, or audios (UNE- SCO, 2024d). recommendations.title: Address and overcome technological determinism in educational and training approaches In Ecuador, there is a growing interest in incorporating artificial intelligence into education.
recommendations.text: Address and overcome technological determinism in educational and training approaches In Ecuador, there is a growing interest in incorporating artificial intelligence into education. However, many initia- tives tend to adopt a technologically deterministic perspective, focusing primarily on the tools rather than the socio-ethical implications of their use. It is essential to shift toward ed- ucational and training approaches that critically examine the broader impacts of AI on society, labor, and individual rights. Curricula at all levels should inte- grate interdisciplinary content that fosters digital literacy, ethical aware- ness, and critical thinking. Addition- ally, teacher training programs must include components on the social and cultural dimensions of technolo- gy. This will ensure that AI is not seen as a neutral or inevitable force, but as a human-centered tool shaped by collective values and democratic governance. Responsible Institutions: Ministry of Education, SENESCYT, Ministry of Labor, MINTEL Priority: High CYT, MINEDUC, MINTEL, universities and GADs must play a leading role in the design and implementation of courses and workshops that ad- dress these social dimensions. recommendations.text: Promote active engagement of the private sector in AI adoption and insights generation The private sector plays a central role in promoting an ethical use of AI in the country, so its participation must be increasingly proactive and committed to integrate the gener- ation of information into national statistics, which would facilitate evi- dence-based decision-making. This sector is instrumental in the adop- tion of new technologies and their 89 National AI Strategy application in various fields, and its commitment to the ethical use of AI is paramount to promote the appro- priate use of this technology at the national level. Thus, the approach to ethical use of AI should include strong private sector involvement, not restricted to public sector initia- tives alone. In terms of information collection, the private sector could invest in track- ing data related to R+D investment, as well as in contracting and imple- menting AI services. Actors such as CITEC and the Ministry of Produc- tion (Mipro) must assume a role that goes beyond the initial promotion and focus on the creation of informa- tion systems that provide evidence on the evolution and penetration of this technology in the market. recommendations.text: Integrate ethics and social implications of technology in secondary education In Ecuador, secondary education programs are beginning to include digital competencies; however, they often lack a critical perspective on the ethical and social implications of emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. It is necessary to go beyond technical training and promote curricula that address is- sues such as algorithmic bias, data privacy, environmental impact, and digital rights. This integration should be interdisciplinary and adapted to the national context, with the aim of fostering responsible digital citizen- ship among youth. Including these topics early in the education system will contribute to a generation of in- formed users and creators of tech- nology who are capable of partici- pating in its ethical governance. Responsible Institutions: Ministry of Education, SENESCYT, Ombudsman's Office Priority: High Ecuador: Artificial Intelligence Readiness Assessment Report 90

recommendations.text: Foster knowledge production on AI and ethics In the field of scientific knowledge production, Ecuador has generated 2,585 indexed publications, which is equivalent to 0.015 publications per 100 inhabitants, considering a population of 17,715,301 inhabitants in 2022. Although this figure offers a starting point, its explanatory capac- ity is limited if it is not complemented by studies that analyse in detail the contents, impacts and applications of these publications. In view of this situation, it is recom- mended that SENESCYT and High- er Education Institutions implement a series of measures to strengthen and make the most of the existing re- search capacities in the country. First, bibliometric studies must be carried out to identify publication patterns, scientific collaboration networks and areas of specialization, facilitating more informed decision-making. In addition, it is suggested to devel- op institutional policies that promote the use of the scientific knowledge generated, promoting its application in local technological developments and solutions to specific problems. It is also imperative to have content on ethics and social studies of science and technology in the training of re- searchers and technicians, covering all educational levels. With these ac- tions, Ecuador can not only increase its scientific production, but also enhance its impact and relevance in society by promoting a cycle of knowledge that responds to local needs and contributes to the sus- tainable development of the country. Responsible Institutions: SENESCYT Priority: Medium

recommendations.title: Create a national repository of public algorithms It is recommended that Ecuador establish a national repository of public algorithms based on open...
recommendations.text: Create a national repository of public algorithms It is recommended that Ecuador establish a national repository of public algorithms based on open standards, consolidating informa- tion on algorithmic systems used or procured by state institutions. This repository must comply with securi- ty and data protection requirements and include technical documenta- tion, operational principles, training datasets, performance metrics, im- pact assessments, and mechanisms for oversight and redress. This is not intended as a passive storage platform, but rather as a tool for active transparency, citizen au- diting, regulatory improvement (e.g., input for regulatory sandboxes), and a driver for local experimentation and technological development. Its exis- tence would strengthen technologi- cal sovereignty, reduce dependence on algorithmic black boxes, and pro- mote open, trustworthy, and ethically grounded innovation. It would po- sition Ecuador as a regional leader in digital governance, aligned with international standards promoted by the OECD, UNESCO, and the Euro- pean Union. recommendations.title: Bridge digital divides and promote inclusive digital transformation MINTEL has a central role in the ex- pansion of digital infrastructure.
recommendations.text: Bridge digital divides and promote inclusive digital transformation MINTEL has a central role in the ex- pansion of digital infrastructure. To achieve this goal, it is necessary to prioritize investment and coverage in rural areas, especially in the nego- tiation of investment contracts with companies that provide telephone and Internet services, where serious connectivity challenges remain. To address inequalities in access, use and appropriation of digi- tal technologies, it is essential to co-design a public policy instrument that integrates linguistic diversity with AI. This instrument should in- clude the creation of databases in Kichwa, Shuar and in the 14 ances- tral languages, ensuring their priority use in essential services based on AI and in automated decision-making processes. Likewise, multisectoral training and awareness-raising strategies must be designed and implemented that promote a critical understanding of the impacts, risks and challenges involved in the use of AI in sectors such as health, education, justice and the provision of social benefits. These actions will contribute to cre- ating a more inclusive society capa- ble of facing the transformations that technology imposes. Responsible Institutions: MINTEL Priority: Medium

recommendations.text: Develop AI-related skills for workforce retraining and adaptation AI skills and their integration into Ec- uador's economic and labor sectors are still limited. Currently, less than 1% of the professions in demand in the labour market are related to this sector (INEC, 2024d). Faced with this situation, it is essential to im- plement a job reconversion strategy that promotes effective collabora- tion between academia, the public sector and the private sector. This will strengthen AI capabilities and align them with global trends, thus facilitating a transformation of labor demand. Specifically, entities such as the Min- istry of Labor, SENESCYT, MINTEL, as well as universities and private sector companies, must play an ac- tive role in the creation of skills linked to AI. It is also critical to consider the 93 National AI Strategy occupational risks associated with the adoption of new technologies, which could replace jobs. Anticipat- ing these challenges would allow for the development of strategies that mitigate job losses, promoting labor reconversion initiatives that prepare workers for new opportunities in a constantly evolving market.
